title: Technology Accelerator Programme - Stevenage, UK
content:
Want to work in tech at an investment bank in Stevenage?
We will provide you with the training you need before you start your role, helping you get the best possible start to your career in tech.
We have exciting technical roles in areas like Network Engineering and Cyber Security at one of our banking clients in Stevenage. This program is specifically for those with or without degrees.  
This role is perfect for you if...

You can demonstrate a passion for technology
You’re analytical and good with numbers.
You have strong skills in written and verbal communication.
It’s a bonus if you already have experience working in teams in a collaborative environment.
you are located within a 20-mile radius of Stevenage
The successful candidate must, by the start of the employment, have permission to work in the UK.

What you’ll learn at the Wiley Edge Academy: 

The training modules cover the tools and concepts required to build software applications using Python. We’ll teach you how to build and manage databases using MySQL and examine concepts and tools related to DevOps Engineering.  
You will also learn DevOps basics, tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, and Docker, as well as at CD/CI using Jenkins, version control, and Lean and Agile approaches to developing software as a team. 
By the end of this course, you will be able to discuss financial and banking concepts at a high level, use Linux to create and automate scripts, demonstrate basic programming skills using Python, use SQL to perform CRUD operations on a dataset; Demonstrate basic concepts related to SRE, Explain DevOps processes to build/test/deploy a software application; discuss CI/CD best practices.
Professional skills and interview techniques.

What you’ll get:

From the moment you join Wiley Edge, our Academy Experience and Engagement teams are there to help you perform at your best. 
You’ll get continuous support with regular check-ins and a personal development plan to help you learn skills relevant to your role. You will also receive a salary increase every 6 months as well as a range of flexible benefits.     
At the end of the program, the majority continue their careers as full-time employees with the client. 
Once on-site at the bank, you’ll continue to develop your skills through online learning, expert-led sessions as well as delivering hands-on project work. 
You'll also have the opportunity to gain external qualifications such as Microsoft Azure Fundamentals, GitLab Training, Agile certifications and lots more, all of which will help propel your career.

How to apply:

Hit ‘Apply Now’ to tell us a bit about you.
Complete the online assessment (we’ll send you a link by email).
Complete the interviews with our friendly talent team and lastly, you’ll interview with our client. 
Get paid while you're trained by our industry experts for 10 weeks (full-time).
Work at our Investment Banking client in Stevenage for 12 months (full-time). You're employed by Wiley Edge while working on site at the bank. You'll continue your learning through a range of upskilling opportunities.

At Wiley Edge, our values support courageous teammates, needle movers, and learning champions all while striving to support the health and well-being of all employees.  We take great pride in celebrating the diversity of each individual who contributes to making Wiley Edge the company it is today and will be in the future. We value diversity both within Wiley Edge and with our partner companies, and we're proud to provide an environment where all our colleagues can flourish. That means promoting a strong culture of equality but, most importantly, inclusion
All Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the UK on a full-time basis. The company will not sponsor applicants for work visas.
Questions about our program and roles? Please get in touch with us at info@wileyedge.com

demographic_questions.description:
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: 

At Wiley Edge, we embrace and uphold the principles of equal-opportunity employment. We firmly believe in treating every individual with fairness and respect, free from discrimination on the grounds of race, religion, ethnicity, sex, age, national origin, marital status, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, different ability, neurodiversity, status as a veteran/member of the armed forces, or any other legally protected status.

Our unwavering commitment extends to fostering an inclusive environment that empowers qualified minorities and advancement within our organization. We continuously strive to improve and ensure that all applicants and employees have an equitable experience throughout their journey with us.

Together, let's create a workplace that celebrates diversity, encourages inclusivity, and champions equal opportunities for all. 

Submitting information is voluntary and your answers in this section will not impact your application through the recruitment process. All information is kept confidential and is collected solely to ensure we’re attracting a diverse population of applicants, to deliver our commitment to diversity.

Disability and/or Different Ability: 

At Wiley Edge we are committed to supporting all staff and recognise that staff with disabilities and/or different abilities or those who may be developing a disability may require additional support to enable them to begin/remain in the workplace.

As a Disability Confident employer we have made a commitment to not only abide by the essential actions but wherever operationally possible to go beyond any statutory legal requirement to support applicants and existing staff to be part of our workforce.

Social Mobility:

Your background shouldn’t determine your future. At Wiley Edge we know we can do more to help people from all backgrounds thrive in work while also improving our own operations. By collecting the below data Wiley Edge are looking to improve our attraction and recruitment processes to best support our candidates and clients.

questions.label: What is the gender you were assigned at birth?
What is your gender identity?
Which of the following best describes your sexual orientation?
What racial or ethnic groups describe you?

answer_options.label: Multi ethnic Group - other multi ethnic background

questions.label: Do you consider yourself to have an impairment or long-term health condition?
Do you have a neurodiverse condition? For example ADHD, Autism, Dyspraxia, Dyslexia to list a few examples
What was the occupation of your main household earner when you were about age 14?

answer_options.label: Modern professional & traditional professional occupations such as: teacher, nurse, physiotherapist, social worker, musician, police officer (sergeant or above), software designer, accountant, solicitor, medical practitioner, scientist or engineer

Senior, middle or junior managers or administrators such as: finance manager, chief executive, large business owner, office manager, retail manager, bank manager, restaurant manager, warehouse manager
Clerical and intermediate occupations such as: secretary, personal assistant, call centre agent, clerical worker, nursery nurse.
Technical and craft occupations such as: motor mechanic, plumber, printer, electrician, gardener, train driver.

Routine, semi-routine manual and service occupations such as: postal worker, machine operative, security guard, caretaker, farm worker, catering assistant, sales assistant, HGV driver, cleaner, porter, packer, labourer, waiter/waitress, bar staff.
Long-term unemployed (claimed Jobseeker’s Allowance or earlier unemployment benefit for more than a year).
Small business owners who employed less than 25 people such as: corner shop owners, small plumbing companies, retail shop owner, single restaurant or café owner, taxi owner, garage owner.
Other such as: retired, this question does not apply to me

questions.label: Which type of school did you attend for the most time between the ages of 11 and 16?

answer_options.label: Independent or fee-paying school, where I received a means tested bursary covering 90% or more of the total cost of attending throughout my time there

questions.label: If you finished school after 1980, were you eligible for free school meals at any point during your school years?

answer_options.label: Not applicable (finished school before 1980 or went to school overseas)

questions.label: Did either of your parents attend university and gain a degree (e.g. BA/BSc or equivalent) by the time you were 18?

answer_options.label: No, neither of my parents attended university
Yes, one or both of my parents attended university

questions.label: Have you ever taken a long period of absence (6 months+) from employment, before re-joining an organisation? (this does not include time studying). E.g. Maternity or parental leave, sabbatical, ill-ness, travel, career change or carer of family member)

We hire in multiple locations across the United Kingdom. Please select which of the following you would like more information about working in.

questions.description:
In order to move forward, you must consent to our privacy policy and terms of service.


- By submitting your information, you confirm you have read the Privacy Policy.
- By selecting Text/SMS, you authorize Wiley’s Edge to contact you via SMS. Message and data rates may apply. Terms.
- By joining our talent network, you are consenting to our organization and our affiliates collecting your personal data and, according to your preferences, contacting you by e-mail, phone or SMS about news, information, events, and job opportunities at our organization that may be of interest.
- By using this service, you agree that we may place cookies on your device and you acknowledge that your personal information may be transferred to other countries if necessary in our hiring process.
questions.label: Privacy Consent

values.label: I agree to the use of my personal information and to being contacted by email and text/SMS as described in our privacy notice and terms of service.
